nodes.name: 🤖 Agent: Fetch LinkedIn Posts (via MCP Tool)

parameters.text:
=Scrape the below user profile on LinkedIn and get the latest 5 post data:
{{ $json.URL }}

parameters.content:
### 🔹 **SECTION 1: Start & Input**

#### 🧩 Nodes:

* `🔘 Trigger: Manual Start`
* `🔗 Set LinkedIn Company URL`

#### 💡 What Happens:

This section is your starting point. You **manually execute** the workflow by clicking the **play button**, and then you **enter the LinkedIn company profile URL** in a form field.

#### ✅ Beginner Tip:

You don’t need coding skills. Just copy the company’s LinkedIn URL (e.g., `https://www.linkedin.com/company/openai`) and paste it here. This kicks off the whole automation!

---

### 🤖 **SECTION 2: Smart Scraper Agent**

#### 🧩 Node:

* `🤖 Agent: Fetch LinkedIn Posts (via MCP Tool)`

##### 🧠 Sub-Nodes Inside the Agent:

* `🧠 Chat Model`: Understands your scraping request in natural language.
* `🌐 Bright Data MCP Client`: Actually visits LinkedIn via mobile proxies and scrapes the data.
* `🧾 Parse AI Response`: Converts raw results into structured post data.

#### 💡 What Happens:

This smart AI agent (powered by OpenAI + Bright Data) goes to the LinkedIn company page, **scrapes the latest 5 posts**, and organizes them. Bright Data MCP lets it **bypass anti-bot systems** by using mobile IPs, so it's reliable even on protected sites like LinkedIn.

#### ✅ Beginner Tip:

You don’t write any scraping code! The AI understands what to do and fetches posts like a human browser would. This is **completely no-code** for you.

---

### 📊 **SECTION 3: Analyze & Save Metrics**

#### 🧩 Nodes:

* `📈 Analyze Engagement Metrics`
* `📥 Save Averages to Google Sheets`

#### 💡 What Happens:

Here, the automation **calculates the average** values (like likes, comments, etc.) from the 5 scraped posts using simple JavaScript logic.

Then, it **saves these average values into your first Google Sheet** so you can track performance over time.

#### ✅ Beginner Tip:

This helps you **measure content engagement** across different companies. You can reuse this for competitive research, content benchmarking, or client reporting.

---

### 📄 **SECTION 4: Format & Store Full Posts**

#### 🧩 Nodes:

* `🧾 Format Post Content`
* `📥 Save Posts to Google Sheets`

#### 💡 What Happens:

Now that averages are stored, this section **formats the full content of the 5 posts** (text, date, likes, etc.) for better readability and structure.

Then, it **stores each individual post into a second Google Sheet** for deeper post-level insights.

#### ✅ Beginner Tip:

This gives you a historical view of what each company is posting—great for content strategy or trend analysis.

---

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

## 🚀 **LinkedIn Company Post Analyzer Workflow**

This automation lets you input a LinkedIn company URL, scrape its **latest 5 posts** using **Bright Data MCP**, calculate **engagement averages**, and store everything neatly in **Google Sheets**. Whether you're a digital marketer, analyst, or business owner—this saves time and effort!

---

### 🔹 **SECTION 1: Start & Input**

#### 🧩 Nodes:

* `🔘 Trigger: Manual Start`
* `🔗 Set LinkedIn Company URL`

#### 💡 What Happens:

This section is your starting point. You **manually execute** the workflow by clicking the **play button**, and then you **enter the LinkedIn company profile URL** in a form field.

#### ✅ Beginner Tip:

You don’t need coding skills. Just copy the company’s LinkedIn URL (e.g., `https://www.linkedin.com/company/openai`) and paste it here. This kicks off the whole automation!

---

### 🤖 **SECTION 2: Smart Scraper Agent**

#### 🧩 Node:

* `🤖 Agent: Fetch LinkedIn Posts (via MCP Tool)`

##### 🧠 Sub-Nodes Inside the Agent:

* `🧠 Chat Model`: Understands your scraping request in natural language.
* `🌐 Bright Data MCP Client`: Actually visits LinkedIn via mobile proxies and scrapes the data.
* `🧾 Parse AI Response`: Converts raw results into structured post data.

#### 💡 What Happens:

This smart AI agent (powered by OpenAI + Bright Data) goes to the LinkedIn company page, **scrapes the latest 5 posts**, and organizes them. Bright Data MCP lets it **bypass anti-bot systems** by using mobile IPs, so it's reliable even on protected sites like LinkedIn.

#### ✅ Beginner Tip:

You don’t write any scraping code! The AI understands what to do and fetches posts like a human browser would. This is **completely no-code** for you.

---

### 📊 **SECTION 3: Analyze & Save Metrics**

#### 🧩 Nodes:

* `📈 Analyze Engagement Metrics`
* `📥 Save Averages to Google Sheets`

#### 💡 What Happens:

Here, the automation **calculates the average** values (like likes, comments, etc.) from the 5 scraped posts using simple JavaScript logic.

Then, it **saves these average values into your first Google Sheet** so you can track performance over time.

#### ✅ Beginner Tip:

This helps you **measure content engagement** across different companies. You can reuse this for competitive research, content benchmarking, or client reporting.

---

### 📄 **SECTION 4: Format & Store Full Posts**

#### 🧩 Nodes:

* `🧾 Format Post Content`
* `📥 Save Posts to Google Sheets`

#### 💡 What Happens:

Now that averages are stored, this section **formats the full content of the 5 posts** (text, date, likes, etc.) for better readability and structure.

Then, it **stores each individual post into a second Google Sheet** for deeper post-level insights.

#### ✅ Beginner Tip:

This gives you a historical view of what each company is posting—great for content strategy or trend analysis.

---

## ✅ Summary: How You Can Use This

| Use Case                     | How It Helps You                                      |
| ---------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- |
| 🔍 Competitive Monitoring    | See what your rivals are posting and how it performs. |
| 📈 Marketing Analytics       | Track brand performance via LinkedIn posts.           |
| 📊 Client Reports            | Automate monthly reports on LinkedIn presence.        |
| 💡 Content Strategy Planning | Analyze what kind of posts get the most engagement.   |

---
